notesStmt.note: Folio 1r: Almanzi's note saying that the work is attributed to Levi ben Gershon (Gersonides aka Ralba"g). Asher Ṿiterbo: inscribed, folio 2r. Yehudah Efrayim Ṿiterbo: inscribed, folio 2r. Camillo Jaghel: inscribed with his name, 1619 (folio 69v); see 50-56. Alessandro de Caii(?): inscribed with his name, 1559 (?) (folio 69v).
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: The supercommentary on Abraham Ibn Ezra's commentary on the Pentateuch.

collation.p: 7 quires: first 6 quires of 10 leaves and the last quire of 7 leaves. Catchwords on the the last page of the quire.

history.provenance: Acquisition: Giuseppe Almanzi (b. 1801, d. 1860), bibliophile; his manuscript no. 99: inscribed (folio 1r]); his library including 322 medieval Hebrew manuscripts were purchased en bloc by the British Museum in October 1865 for £1,000 (see 131-153), inscribed, [71v].
